Maria Finkelmeier Maria Finkelmeier

How I Turned My Music into 3D Visual Art: Melody Figments

What if every motion you made with your hands left a trail of colorful lights? Imagine if a pen, a pointer, or a percussionist‚Äôs mallets were paintbrushes!

I combined my passion for music, technology, and visual art to create Melody Figments‚Äîdigital art pieces that visually capture the nuances of musical performance. By mapping my movements with 30 motion-tracking nodes, we transformed them into dynamic visual forms, creating an immersive experience that blends sound and sight.

Read More

Maria Finkelmeier Maria Finkelmeier

5 Essential Tips for Succeeding as a Composer in 2024

Aspiring composers, this is for you! üåü

Here I share "5 Things You Need to Know to Succeed as a Composer in 2024." From finding inspiration across genres to perfecting your pitch, these insights will transform your creative journey.

Transforming a 1,000-Foot Bridge into a Musical Instrument

Discover how I turned the Roebling Bridge into a musical instrument and an immersive light experience for the Blink Festival in Cincinnati. From sound mapping to syncing music with lights, this project brought the bridge to life in a whole new way. üåâ‚ú®

Performing Mindset for Creative Entrepreneurs: Key Strategies

Why Adopt a Performing Mindset? The performing mindset transcends the literal act of performing. It‚Äôs about presenting ideas and engaging with your audience‚Äîbe it in a concert hall, during a pitch, or across social media.

Project Maria Finkelmeier Project Maria Finkelmeier

The PULSE of my neighborhood

The MF Dynamics winter show, Pulse, at ROUNDHEAD BREWING COMPANY in Hyde Park, Boston, presented by DEPARTURE ARTS became a massive celebration of community, neighbors, family, and percussion + lights experiments. Made possible by the Mass Cultural Council, the event featured performances by Emma Terrell, Denver Nuckolls, Maria Finkelmeier, and a light-painting booth by Jess Holz.

Read More

Project Cait Winston Project Cait Winston

New eyes and ears on DESCENDED

This multidisciplinary piece, which lives outside of conventional genre classification, was aptly described by performers Jean Laurenz, Maria Finkelmeier, and Greg Jukes as ‚Äòchamber theater.‚Äô This label perfectly acknowledges the way that all elements of composition, staging, film, performance, and visual effects contribute to the narrative.

Project, Shows Jane Long Project, Shows Jane Long

MF Dynamics Goes Digital

A deeper dive into MF Dynamics creation and sales of NFTs along with an inside look at the recent performance at Roundhead Brewery that featured live, responsive visuals and a special NFT gift for attendees. By Elisabeth Sweet, Head of Community at MF Dynamics

Interview Maria Finkelmeier Interview Maria Finkelmeier

Interview with Maria Finkelmeier

My name is Denver Nuckolls, and I am thrilled to have recently spoken with Maria Finkelmeier, creative catalyst and founder of MF Dynamics, in the first of four conversations that we hope will assist audiences and aspiring artists in demystifying the thoughts, processes, and goals of a professional in the field.

Read More

Shows Nomi Joy Marcus Shows Nomi Joy Marcus

Reflecting on the premiere of "the Me you See"

Maria‚Äôs new work for large, flexible ensemble, the Me you See, premiered on Saturday, April 20 at the Longy School of Music as part of the New Gallery Concert Series‚Äô season finale. The work invited audience members to fully immerse themselves in the theme of the event, to ‚Äúadopt and adapt.‚Äù

Nomi Joy Marcus Nomi Joy Marcus

Premiering "the Me you See" @ New Gallery Concert Series' "Adopt and Adapt"

On April 30, the New Gallery Concert Series will host its first in-person live event since the pandemic started. The event, titled ‚ÄúAdopt and Adapt‚Äù will take place at the Longy School of Music, and will feature performances of original works created for this event by local composers, including our very own Maria Finkelmeier!

Nomi Joy Marcus Nomi Joy Marcus

DESCENDED Review in The Whole Note

DESCENDED is featured in a review by Max Christie in this month‚Äôs The Whole Note magazine! Max writes: ‚ÄúDescended is a project that warrants close listening. It‚Äôs not an easy collection to categorize.‚Äù

Project, tour, Update Nomi Joy Marcus Project, tour, Update Nomi Joy Marcus

Getting Back Into the Groove with VALIS

MF Dynamic‚Äôs fearless leader, Maria, recently took part in a weeklong performance workshop of Tod Machover‚Äôs 1987 opera, VALIS, at MIT, led by the composer himself and director, Jay Scheib.

Read More

Nomi Joy Marcus Nomi Joy Marcus

FREQUENCIES, Round 2: Bringing the Joy to Warm Up the Winter

Fittingly, for our first blog of 2022 we are revisiting the subject of our last blog of 2021: FREQUENCIES. Since it was first mounted back in the Fall, ‚ÄúFrequencies‚Äù has lit up the night and will continue to do so every night from 5:00 - 10:00 PM through February 28.

Read More

Project, Update, Shows Nomi Joy Marcus Project, Update, Shows Nomi Joy Marcus

Digging into the Process Behind FREQUENCIES

The mf team is gearing up to bring some much needed joyful ambiance to the Harvard Ed Portal this Fall. FREQUENCIES is a crowdsourced audio/visual mural that features the sounds and sights of Allston-Brighton, straight from the people who live, work, and play in this vibrant Boston neighborhood. Maria will be collaborating with visual artist, Allison Tanenhaus on this nightly pulsating performance that will run from November 2021 - February 2022.

Read More

Project Nomi Joy Marcus Project Nomi Joy Marcus

The Fishermen's Wives of Gloucester

‚ÄúCenturies in the Making: Gloucester‚Äôs Wives & Fisherman Shine On‚Äù is a collaboration bringing mfD back together with Luminartz and Hersch Visuals to honor the 20th anniversary of the unveiling of the Gloucester Fishermen‚Äôs Wives Memorial, a contribution to this fishing community by the Gloucester Fishermen‚Äôs Wives Association. The project will celebrate the tireless efforts of the women of this organization whose contributions include, ‚Äúpromoting the New England fishing industry, helping to preserve the Atlantic Ocean as a food supply for the world, and assisting active and retired fishermen and their families to live better lives.‚Äù

Read More

Nomi Joy Marcus Nomi Joy Marcus

Weaving Data and Stories into Art: A Look the Process of "Threads"

‚ÄúThreads of Assumption: The Biases We Weave‚Äù opens in 2 weeks, and in preparation, Maria and her co-collaborators held a retreat earlier this week to unpack the source material and determine the process for creating this exciting and thought provoking multi-disciplinary installation.
